headline: Citigroup (C) Valuation Check After Recent Pullback And Modest Undervaluation Signal
summary: Context for Citigroup after recent price moves Citigroup (C) has seen its share price slip about 1.8% in the last day and roughly 3.8% over the past week, resulting in a 6.6% decline over the past month for investors tracking shorter term moves. See our latest analysis for Citigroup. While the recent 1 month share price return of a 6.6% decline suggests momentum has cooled, Citigroup’s 14.99% 3 month share price return and 43.28% 1 year total shareholder return point to a stronger backdrop...

headline: Citi is Bullish on Newmont Corporation (NEM)
summary: Newmont Corporation (NYSE:NEM) is among the 15 Best Performing Silver Stocks to Buy. According to TheFly, Citi lifted Newmont Corporation (NYSE:NEM)’s price goal from $104 to $118 and kept its Buy rating on January 12. Updated company guidelines and commodity price estimates are reflected in the modification. After a notable surge, Citi declared that it […]

headline: Assessing Sherwin-Williams (SHW) Valuation After Fresh Citi And RBC Confidence Boost
summary: Recent commentary from Citi and RBC Capital has put Sherwin-Williams (SHW) back in focus, highlighting an elevated housing outlook through 2027, planned restructuring cost savings, and continued execution on price increases. See our latest analysis for Sherwin-Williams. The recent Citi and RBC commentary comes as Sherwin-Williams trades at US$348.52, with a 30-day share price return of 7.12% and a year-to-date share price return of 6.31%. Its 5-year total shareholder return of 58.01%...
